pain_points_original.title: Overwhelming Security & Data Privacy Risks
pain_points_original.description: The buyer is critically concerned about compliance with government ICT security policies and Information Privacy Principles (IPPs). Safeguarding sensitive government data is a non-negotiable requirement.

pain_points_original.title: Risk of Failed Implementation & Unproven Tech
pain_points_original.description: Lacking internal AI experience, the buyer is highly risk-averse. They require strong evidence of successful deployments in similar government contexts and want to explore pilot programs to avoid costly failures.

pain_points_original.title: Addressing Core Government Inefficiencies
pain_points_original.description: The fundamental driver is the need to fix core operational problems. The buyer seeks AI to directly boost efficiency, improve decision-making, enhance service delivery, and achieve better community outcomes.

pain_points_original.title: Complex Integration with Existing Systems
pain_points_original.description: The buyer is concerned about the difficulty, cost, and disruption of integrating new AI solutions with existing government systems. They need to assess the adaptability and scalability of vendor solutions.

pain_points_original.title: Unpredictable Costs and Unclear ROI
pain_points_original.description: The buyer needs clear, predictable costing models to plan budgets and justify expenditure. They must build a strong business case for AI investment based on tangible efficiency and service delivery gains.
